success_metrics.metric: Monitoring coverage and breach detection latency
success_metrics.target: 100% of vendors monitored per tier frequency (Critical daily, High weekly, Medium monthly, Low quarterly); All vendor breaches detected within ≤24 hours from public disclosure; ≥95% monitored per tier frequency
success_metrics.measurement: Monitoring coverage: Count vendors monitored per tier / total vendors per tier; Breach detection latency: Time from public disclosure to system detection (median, P95)
success_metrics.data_source: Vendor monitoring system logs (polling/webhook events by vendor tier), breach detection timestamps vs. public disclosure timestamps (HaveIBeenPwned, Risk Based Security, vendor notifications)
success_metrics.frequency: Monitoring coverage: daily automated check; Breach detection latency: measured per incident
success_metrics.baseline: Monitoring coverage: 40-70% vendors monitored manually pre-automation; Breach detection: 7-30 days manual discovery
success_metrics.validation: Daily monitoring coverage check (automated script verify all vendors monitored per tier schedule); Post-incident breach detection review (compare our detection time to public disclosure time)

success_metrics.target: ≥80% of software vendors provide SBOMs, ≥95% of Critical vendors; 100% of vendor vulnerabilities logged, tracked to remediation, MTTR ≤30 days (High), ≤7 days (Critical)
success_metrics.measurement: SBOM coverage: Count software vendors with current SBOMs / total software vendors (overall and by tier); Vulnerability tracking: Count vulnerabilities logged and tracked / total vulnerabilities detected; MTTR: Median time from vulnerability discovery to remediation verified by vendor tier
success_metrics.data_source: SBOM ingestion logs (SBOM received, parsing completed, validation performed), vulnerability discovery logs (CVE detected, severity assigned), vendor notification logs (vendor notified, remediation deadline, remediation verified)
success_metrics.frequency: SBOM coverage: monthly tracking; Vulnerability tracking: continuous logging, monthly review; MTTR: calculated per vulnerability, monthly aggregate
success_metrics.baseline: SBOM coverage: 0-20% vendors provide SBOMs pre-requirement; Vulnerability tracking: 50-70% vulnerabilities tracked manually; MTTR: 60-120 days manual tracking
success_metrics.validation: Monthly SBOM coverage audit (verify software vendors have current SBOMs uploaded ≤90 days old); Quarterly vulnerability tracking audit (verify 100% of vulnerabilities logged, tracked to remediation, MTTR calculated correctly); Monthly MTTR review (verify Critical ≤7 days, High ≤30 days SLA compliance)

success_metrics.target: 100% of compliance events logged (regulatory, contract SLA, DPA); Zero regulatory violations due to missing logs; Risk assessment throughput ≥100 vendors/hour, SBOM processing ≥50/hour, API response time p95 ≤2 seconds
success_metrics.measurement: Compliance logging: Count compliance events logged / total compliance events (manual audit ground truth); Regulatory violations: Count violations attributed to missing logs; Performance: Vendors assessed / hour, SBOMs scanned / hour, API response P95 latency
success_metrics.data_source: Compliance logging (regulatory compliance tracking, contract compliance monitoring, DPA monitoring logs), regulatory violation incident reports (root cause analysis), performance monitoring logs (risk assessment throughput, SBOM scanning throughput, API response times)
success_metrics.frequency: Compliance logging: continuous logging, quarterly audit; Regulatory violations: measured per incident; Performance: continuous monitoring, weekly review
success_metrics.baseline: Compliance logging: 60-80% compliance events logged manually; Regulatory violations: 1-3 violations per year due to missing logs; Performance: 50-75 vendors/hour, 25-40 SBOMs/hour, API P95 3-5 seconds
success_metrics.validation: Quarterly compliance logging audit (manual review verify 100% of compliance events logged, sample 100 events verify complete logging); Annual regulatory audit (external or internal: verify zero violations due to missing logs); Weekly performance monitoring (verify risk assessment throughput ≥100 vendors/hour, SBOM processing ≥50/hour, API P95 ≤2 seconds)

success_metrics.target: Alert latency ≤5 minutes for critical events; ≤10% false positive rate on alerts; 100% compliance with retention requirements (7 years for audit/security logs)
success_metrics.measurement: Alert latency: Time from event occurrence to alert delivery (median, P95); False positive rate: False positive alerts / total alerts (manual validation); Log retention compliance: Count logs retained per retention policy / total logs by log type (security, audit, operational)
success_metrics.data_source: Vendor security alerting logs (alert generation timestamps, alert delivery timestamps), alert validation (manual review determine true/false positives), log management infrastructure (log retention policies, log storage hot/warm/cold, log retention compliance)
success_metrics.frequency: Alert latency: continuous monitoring; False positive rate: monthly alert validation review; Log retention compliance: quarterly audit
success_metrics.baseline: Alert latency: hours to days manual alerts; False positive rate: 15-25% without tuning; Log retention compliance: 70-85% compliance manual retention
success_metrics.validation: Weekly alert latency test (synthetic alerts to verify delivery within ≤5 minutes); Monthly false positive audit (manual review 100 random alerts verify ≤10% false positives, tune alert thresholds); Quarterly log retention audit (verify 100% of security/audit logs retained 7 years, operational logs 90 days, storage tiering hot/warm/cold correct)

success_metrics.metric: Vendor data access logging and supply chain monitoring
success_metrics.target: 100% of platform access logged (user login, vendor data viewed, modifications, bulk exports); 100% of vendor portal access logged; 100% of subprocessor changes logged; Concentration risk alerts (≥30% vendors depend on single component)
success_metrics.measurement: Platform access logging: Count platform access events logged / total platform access events (audit all access, no events missed); Vendor portal access logging: Count vendor portal access events logged / total vendor portal access events; Subprocessor logging: Count subprocessor changes logged / total subprocessor changes (vendor disclosure ground truth); Concentration risk: Count concentration risk alerts / total concentration risk instances (≥30% vendors single component)
success_metrics.data_source: Platform access logs (user login/logout, vendor data viewed, risk assessment modified, reports generated, bulk exports, admin actions), vendor portal access logs (vendor login, questionnaire submitted, SBOM uploaded, assessment results viewed, remediation evidence uploaded), subprocessor tracking logs (new subprocessor added/removed/changed, subprocessor risk assessment completed), dependency risk monitoring logs (vulnerable component shared by multiple vendors, concentration risk threshold exceeded)
success_metrics.frequency: Platform access logging: continuous logging, monthly audit; Vendor portal access logging: continuous logging, monthly audit; Subprocessor logging: continuous logging, quarterly audit; Concentration risk: continuous monitoring, monthly review
success_metrics.baseline: Platform access logging: 70-90% access events logged manually; Vendor portal access logging: 50-70% access events logged; Subprocessor logging: 30-50% subprocessor changes tracked manually; Concentration risk: 0-40% concentration risk detected manually
success_metrics.validation: Monthly platform access logging audit (verify 100% of platform access events logged, sample 100 events verify complete logging user ID/role/action/vendors accessed/IP/timestamp); Monthly vendor portal access logging audit (verify 100% of vendor portal access events logged, sample 50 events verify complete logging vendor/action/IP/timestamp/file uploaded); Quarterly subprocessor logging audit (verify 100% of subprocessor changes logged, cross-reference with vendor disclosure requirements GDPR Article 28); Monthly concentration risk review (verify all concentration risk instances ≥30% vendors single component detected, alerts generated)
